intro: Cynoglossum platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-calyx bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in late summer. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower displays.
